bibl.title: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II
bibl.note: The 300,000 recipients under Justinian represented the number of adult inhabitants of both sexes above fourteen years of age. This result gives a total population of 525,000 including children.
bibl.seg: El Abbadi Mostafa, The Grain Supply of Alexandria and Its Population in Byzantine Times.
Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Papyrology. II (Athens, 1988) pp. 317-323.
The 300,000 recipients under Justinian represented the number of adult inhabitants of both sexes above fourteen years of age. This result gives a total population of 525,000 including children.
